dt: {bc}all learning exclusive of technical {d_link|precepts|precept} and practical arts
{bc}the sciences and liberal arts {d_link|exclusive of|exclusive of} medicine, law, and theology
{bc}the 4-year college course of a major seminary
{bc}a discipline comprising as its core {d_link|logic|logic}, aesthetics, ethics, {d_link|metaphysics|metaphysics}, and epistemology
{bc}a search for a general understanding of values and reality by chiefly {d_link|speculative|speculative} rather than observational means
{bc}an analysis of the grounds of and concepts expressing fundamental beliefs
{bc}a theory underlying or regarding a sphere of activity or thought
{bc}the most basic beliefs, concepts, and attitudes of an individual or group
{bc}calmness of temper and judgment befitting a {a_link|philosopher}

quotes.t: Almost none of the kids were older than twenty-five, as if there were a sell-by date on radical social {qword}philosophy{/qword}, a legal age limit after which one must surrender lofty ideals and shave off all dreadlocks.

In their mission statement, the editors bragged of their firm commitment to equality and social justice, but their {qword}philosophy{/qword} didn't prevent them from summoning Lindsey to perform all their menial tasks.

There's plenty of blame to go around: poor regulation, eight years of a failed Republican economic {qword}philosophy{/qword}, Wall Street-friendly Democrats who helped stymie reform, misguided bipartisan efforts to promote home ownership, Wall Street greed, corrupt CEOs, a botched rescue effort, painfully fallible central bankers.
Broadly speaking, {qword}philosophy{/qword} has three concerns: how the world hangs together, how our beliefs can be justified, and how to live.

et: Middle English {it}philosophie{/it}, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}philosophia{/it}, from Greek, from {it}philosophos{/it} philosopher
shortdef: all learning exclusive of technical precepts and practical arts
the sciences and liberal arts exclusive of medicine, law, and theology
the 4-year college course of a major seminary

dt: {bc}an overall vision of or attitude toward life and the purpose of life
{bc}any of various philosophies that emphasize human life or life in general

shortdef: an overall vision of or attitude toward life and the purpose of life
any of various philosophies that emphasize human life or life in general

dt: {bc}a philosophical movement that seeks the solution of philosophical problems in the analysis of propositions or sentences

shortdef: a philosophical movement that seeks the solution of philosophical problems in the analysis of propositions or sentences —called also philosophical analysis

dt: {bc}the highest degree awarded in many academic disciplines

dt.t: She graduated with a {wi}doctor of philosophy{/wi} in education/mathematics/history.
Most have advanced degrees, including a few {wi}doctors of philosophy{/wi} …

dt: {bc}a person who has earned the academic degree of doctor of philosophy

dt.t: Baranowski is director of the Homestead Agricultural and Research Education Center, a 160-acre farming laboratory of scientists in blue jeans, {wi}doctors of philosophy{/wi} with dusty boots.

shortdef: the highest degree awarded in many academic disciplines; also : a person who has earned the academic degree of doctor of philosophy —abbreviation PhD, Ph.D.

dt: {bc}the study of human conduct and values

shortdef: ethics; also : the study of human conduct and values

dt: {bc}a trend in philosophical analysis that seeks to resolve philosophical perplexity by revealing sources of puzzlement in the misunderstanding of ordinary language

shortdef: a trend in philosophical analysis that seeks to resolve philosophical perplexity by revealing sources of puzzlement in the misunderstanding of ordinary language
